result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank Byrd Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Frank Byrd Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Frank Byrd Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Frank Byrd Jr. was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.  Costs and restitution to be paid during extended supervision.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.
** Pay DNA surcharge.  May Not have contact with Yolanda T or Charles D unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP concurrent to 14CF931; 1 1/2 years initial confinement w/credit for 160 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge; on ct 3 the court imposes sentence of 6 months jail concurrent to ct 1 and 14CF931; costs ordered, $200 DNA surcharge ordered, restitution ordered in the amount of $40.39, all to be paid during period of extended supervision.

from Sarah Theiermann @ DOC

Defendant Frank  Byrd appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Reserve Judge Stephen A. Simanek, acting today only.
14CF931: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 Substantial Battery; found guilty by the court.
14CF938: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 BJ-Fel and Ct 3 Retail Theft ; found guilty by the court. Ct 2 dismissed on ST's motion.
14CM1247: Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1 Knowingly Violate Dom Abuse Injunction; found guilty by the court. Cts 2 & 3 dismissed but read in.
Presentence Investigation ordered. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/7/14 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.
